Class TuitionManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • TuitionManager

  • public class TuitionManager
extends java.lang.Object
    The TuitionManager class acts as a user interface while reading from standard input and display standard output. This class is running until done = true and keeps taking commands, validating them and executing them if they are correct. This class allows us to add and remove students as well as display all current students with their calculated tuition.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        The Run method start the interface and waits for commands. Initializes the scanners and while done = false, it runs and takes the next command. Checks if the command is valid after tokenizing the input.

      • add

        private void add(java.lang.String firstName,
                 java.lang.String lastName,
                 int studentType,
                 int credit,
                 int funds)
        The add method checks for duplication, and then adds the student to the team if it doesn't exist.
        Parameters:
        firstName - The student first name.
        lastName - The student last name.
        credit - Number of credits taken by student.
        studentType - The student type: IN_STATE / OUT_OF_STATE / INTERNATIONAL.
        funds - The additional data provided. An Integer that represents funds.

      • add

        private void add(java.lang.String firstName,
                 java.lang.String lastName,
                 int studentType,
                 int credit,
                 char state)
        The add method checks for duplication, and then adds the student to the team if it doesn't exist.
        Parameters:
        firstName - The student first name.
        lastName - The student last name.
        credit - Number of credits taken by student.
        studentType - The student type: IN_STATE / OUT_OF_STATE / INTERNATIONAL.
        state - a Char representing true/false for isTriState and isExchange. In a form of 'T' - true and 'F- false that's gonna be parsed later.

      • remove

        private void remove(java.lang.String firstName,
                    java.lang.String lastName)
        The remove method removes a student from the student list, unless the student is not an actual member. If member exists, it removes him and the last item in the array replaces it's position.
        Parameters:
        firstName - The first name of the student to be removed.
        lastName - The last name of the student to be removed.

      • print

        private void print()
        The print method outputs all students in the list. If the team is empty it displays that it has 0 students.
